fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64429].
  {panel}

If you try to import a large CSV file it can cause JIRA to become unresponsive as it gets stuck in full GC and will eventually generate an OutOfMemoryError: GC Overhead limit exceeded.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to import the attached CSV.

h3. Expected Results:

It would be ideal if JIRA could verify whether or not the file is a certain size and refuse to import it rather than negatively affect the the instance.

h3. Actual Results:

It will use up all the memories and JIRA will eventually generate an OOME:

{noformat}
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded
	at org.apache.lucene.store.BufferedIndexInput.refill(BufferedIndexInput.java:210)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.BufferedIndexInput.readByte(BufferedIndexInput.java:39)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.IndexInput.readInt(IndexInput.java:71)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.BufferedIndexInput.readInt(BufferedIndexInput.java:153)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentTermEnum.<init>(SegmentTermEnum.java:50)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.TermInfosReader.<init>(TermInfosReader.java:110)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentCoreReaders.<init>(SegmentCoreReaders.java:75)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.get(SegmentReader.java:114)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:701)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:676)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.BufferedDeletesStream.applyDeletes(BufferedDeletesStream.java:249)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.doFlush(IndexWriter.java:3552)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.flush(IndexWriter.java:3489)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.prepareCommit(IndexWriter.java:3352)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commitInternal(IndexWriter.java:3425)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3407)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3391)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.WriterWrapper.commit(WriterWrapper.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$WriterReference.commit(DefaultIndexEngine.java:220)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$FlushPolicy$2.commit(DefaultIndexEngine.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$FlushPolicy.perform(DefaultIndexEngine.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine.write(DefaultIndexEngine.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndex.perform(DefaultIndex.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.index(QueueingIndex.java:144)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.run(QueueingIndex.java:125)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
{noformat}

h3. Notes:

File to replicate and my GC log attached. In this particular example the problem was present due to over 1 million "empty" lines:

{noformat}
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Remove the empty lines using your favourite text editor and attempt the import again. In this example I did it with the following:

{noformat}
cat filename.csv | grep -v ",,,,,^M" > modified.csv
{noformat}

The difference:

{noformat}
$ wc -l modified.csv 
      52 modified.csv
$ wc -l filename.csv 
 1048605 filename.csv
{noformat}

Currently the Import CSV functionality needs to have the 'Date Import' format specified during the import process. This can cause some problems during import if it's not set correctly, for example the parsing fails with the below exception:

{noformat}
2015-05-01 15:35:19,876 WARN - Cannot add value [ 04/24/2015 ] to CustomField Build date in Issue with summary 'New Accessory Launch: SUPM44640 - HTC M9 Tech 21 Impact Shield'. Exception Message: Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "dd/MMM/yy".
com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "dd/MMM/yy".
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.converters.DatePickerConverterImpl.getTimestamp(DatePickerConverterImpl.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.DateCFType.getSingularObjectFromString(DateCFType.java:121)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.DateCFType.getSingularObjectFromString(DateCFType.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType.getValueFromCustomFieldParams(AbstractSingleFieldType.java:230)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.customfields.CustomFieldValueFactory.prepareValueForCustomField(CustomFieldValueFactory.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.customfields.CustomFieldsUtil.setCustomFieldValueForIssue(CustomFieldsUtil.java:182)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importExternalCustomFields(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:1244)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.createIssue(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:895)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:771)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:397)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:15)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:528)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:491)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:254)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
{noformat}

It would be ideal if the importer plugin could automagically figure out what the date format is, using science, so that users don't have to set this, as it can be a bit confusing.

h3. Set the 'Date Format' correctly during import.
fields.summary: Automate the Date Format functionality in Import CSV

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64420].
  {panel}

The latest JIM version ships with the beta version of JSON importer/exporter. However, the JSON importer/exporter modules are not enabled by default, hence the modules needs to be enabled manually by going to {{Administration > Manage Add-ons > Show System Plugins > JIRA Importers Plugin}}, and enable the following modules:
- JSON (beta)(searchrequest-json)
- JSON (beta)(issue-json)

However, this step is not documented anywhere in the JIM documentation. It will be great if we can have this documented in JIM documentation, so that users will know that they have to enable the JSON module first before using it in JIRA.
fields.summary: Improve JIM JSON importer/exporter documentation
Create issue with all details at once

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64418].
  {panel}

Customer has suggested an implementation of new features such as

"Test Run":
Feature which runs a list of checking on the csv files to filter out the errors and warnings which will possibly hit into during the import. This allow user to perform correction on the respective csv files before the import.

Stop Import Option:
A feature to stop import once a warning or errors has been found. A checkbox can be included at the import wizard where the user can select whether to ignore warnings or halt (&rollback) on warning. This can avoid user to import issues which may have lost some information due to the warnings(such as format).
fields.summary: "Test Run" feature or "Stop Import Option" for CSV importer

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64414].
{panel}
{panel}
h3. Summary

Drag and Drop attachments not working in Firefox 52.0 (or never)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use Firefox 52.0 (or never)
 # Go to an Issue and try to add an attachment by dragging and dropping the file

h3. Expected Results

The file is attached in the issue
h3. Actual Results
 * On Windows: The browser opens the file and the file isn't attached to the Issue
 [^Recording #2.mp4]
 * On Mac OS: The file gets neither opened nor attached. The file cannot be dropped.

h3. Note:
 * in JIRA Agile, if we click on an issue from the backlog view, when we drag and drop an attachment to it, we get an error: "Exception: TypeError: o.contains is not a function".{panel}
h2. Workaround
 - For users of JIRA 7.2.x
 Upgrade [JIRA Drag and Drop Attachment Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-dnd-attachment-plugin/server/overview] to {{4.3.10}} using Atlassian Marketplace:
 [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-dnd-attachment-plugin/version/166]

 - For users of JIRA 7.3.x
 Download the attached file: [^jira-dnd-attachment-plugin-4.4.10.jar], go to Administration -> Add-ons -> Manage add-ons, use the option "Upload add-on" and select the downloaded file. This is going to install a patched version of JIRA Drag and Drop Attachment Plugin on your JIRA 7.3.x instance
fields.summary: Drag and Drop attachments not working in Firefox 52.0+

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When pasting an image into the rich text editor, Jira will not apply the "thumbnail" size to it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
While editing a comment or description, paste an image to the issue.

h3. Expected Results
Jira will use the {{|thumbnail}} option for displaying images.

h3. Actual Results
Jira does not use the {{|thumbnail}} option for displaying images, and displays it in full size.

h3. Workaround
By selecting the attachment from the {{+}} menu on the rich text editor, Jira will use the {{|thumbnail}} option and insert the image at a smaller size.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64403].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary

If a customer attempts to write a JQL that compares to date fields, this JQL is unacceptable by JIRA because it currently unsupported as [our expected|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html] supports only specific dates in the format {{YYYY/MM/dd}}, {{startofmonth()}} or durations like {{"-3w"}} (_refer to the Created section_).

h5. Usage Scenario

If a development team would like to compare or measure how many fixes were released before the scheduled due date, it would be great to be able to create a report that compares using JQL:
{code}
releasedate < "due date"
{code}

h5. Existing Behavior

JIRA would throw an error if you attempt to use the JQL as defined above as it would expect you to use the duration or actual date as described in the summary section.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would allow the user to compare JQL of 2 different date fields.
fields.summary: Allow comparison of Date Fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Groups synced from a user directory setup as LDAP read-only, with local groups, should be read-only, but JIRA allows you to add and remove users from other user directories.  These changes are not synced to the LDAP server.

h3. Environment
* LDAP user directory configured "LDAP read-only, with local groups"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a LDAP user directory as "LDAP read-only, with local groups" (LDAP-1)
# Setup a second LDAP user directory as  "LDAP read-only, with local groups" (LDAP-2)
# Try to add a user from LDAP-2 to a group from LDAP-1 (works even though LDAP-1 is read-only)
# Try to add a user from LDAP-1 to a group from LDAP-1 (fails as it should)

h3. Expected Results
Both group edits should fail because their user directories are configured as read-only.

h3. Actual Results
The addition of a user from LDAP-2 to a group from LDAP-1 is allowed.
fields.summary: LDAP read-only, with local groups allows addition/removal of users from other user directories

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
h3. The JIRA audit log does not include screen changes described in [Auditing in JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/auditing-in-jira-applications-861253882.html].
h3. *Repro steps*
 # Log in as a user with the *JIRA Administrators* global permission.
 # Create a new screen (*gg* > *Screens* > *Add Screen*),
 # Add fields to the first tab on the screen.
 # Go to *gg* > *Screen Schemes* and select any screen scheme.
 # Select *Associate an issue operation with a screen*.
 # Choose any issue operation and select the screen you just created.
 # Select *Add*.
 # View the Audig Log (*gg* > *Audit Log*).

h3. *Expected Results*

The Audit Log contains events describing the following changes:
 * Screen field configuration changed
 * Screen scheme edited
 * Etc

h3. *Actual Results*

No audit log entries exist which refer to screen changes of any kind.
(!) In JIRA 7.4 some operations on screens are reflected in Audit Log, namely editing fields on screens (adding field, removing it, changing order) and editing tabs (adding, removing, changing order)
fields.summary: Audit log does not include screen changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64396].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

According to the [JIRA REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.3.3] documentation, {{POST /rest/api/2/user}} can be used to create a new user, and that user will be created in the first writable directory in directory order for the application making the request. 

h3. Suggested Solution

As an improvement, we could allow the ability to specify a directory when adding users. This could make the process more transparent and give the administrator more control by taking out the element of chance, in the event the administrator is unaware of the directories mapped to an application and the order they're in.
fields.summary: Allow new users to be created in specific directories via the REST API
Create an admin panel to see and edit user properties (Not UI user properties)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64392].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the present moment, all notifications sent by JIRA refer to the same Message-ID in the *In-Reply-to:* header, causing e-mails to not get threaded properly in mail clients when messages are not sorted by ascending date.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make each notification sent by JIRA refer to the previous notification e-mail's Message-ID, creating a proper relation between e-mail notifications.

h3. Why this is important
This will allow e-mail notifications to stay in the proper order should the user use a sorting option other than by ascending date.
fields.summary: JIRA should thread e-mails properly

h3. Summary

JIRA Issue collector behaviour in latest Safari on OSX is confusing. This browser has disabled 3rd party cookies by default and despite the warning about this, you can still create issues. But when you hit the submit button you see another warning saying "there was a problem submitting your feedback". I.e.: *you can't submit issues on Safari by default*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to staging Bitbucket (staging.bb-inf.net) with Atlassian account in Safari
 # Go to Labs (tab on the left) and enable "Atlassian editor" integration
 # Go to [https://staging.bb-inf.net/owallhult/sverige/pull-requests/1/readmemd-edited-online-with-bitbucket/diff] and try to add any comment. In the top right corner of the editor there's a "Feedback" button. Press it to open JIRA Issue Collector iframe.

h3. Expected Results
 * Warning about 3rd party cookies is brighter and "submit" button is either disabled or hidden at all.

h3. Actual Results
 * Warning about disabled 3rd party cookies is small and the submit button is still active
 * When you click the submit button you see a confusing message (summary)
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Collector cannot create issues in Safari with disabled 3rd party cookies (submit button is still active)

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a JIRA instance have more than 65000 issues with all worklog on each ticket before '2016-01-01'
# Go to the issue search page and run the JQL {{worklogDate < '2016-01-01'}}

h3. Expected behaviour
It should show the result with all issue. 

h3. Actual behaviour
It gives an error on the UI:
{{An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search.}}

The same issue reproduced with the clause worklogAuthor

h3. Workaround solution
* With the bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-64315, it is still possible to use the lower case clause which is {{worklogdate}} and {{worklogauthor}} to get the output.

fields.summary: Issue search with worklog clause throws an error "An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search."

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA populates *activeUsersCountForLicense* cache in inefficient way
h3. Environment
 * Large number of users: 10k+
{code:java}
// SQL to get all users
select directory_id,count(1) from cwd_user group by directory_id;    
//SQL to get active users
select directory_id,count(1) from cwd_user where active=1 group by directory_id;      
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # TBD
 # Enable debug logging for _com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager_

h3. Expected Results

JIRA populates the cache fast.
h3. Actual Results

Cache population is slow, majority of the incoming http threads are waiting for {{getUserCount}} method (_activeUsersCountForLicense_ cache) to be populated.

Enabling debug logging will show cache population time:
{noformat}
2017-03-10 12:16:16,700 http-nio-8080-exec-539 DEBUG user 736x6651698x30 1se 1.0.0.0 /secure/MyJiraHome.jspa [c.a.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager] JIRA Software count: 4800
2017-03-10 12:16:16,700 http-nio-8080-exec-539 DEBUG user 736x6651698x30 1se 1.0.0.0 /secure/MyJiraHome.jspa [c.a.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager] Count application users: 7.938 s JIRA Software
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Note that JIRA with license _JIRA Software (Server) Unlimited Users_ is not affected, as license check is always true.
 (License is checked in 7.2.9 - JRASERVER-65462)

Threads waiting for {{getUserCount}} method:
{noformat}
 grep -A 20 'http-nio' jira_threads.1488804924.txt | grep -A 19 'java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING' | grep -c 'com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.getUserCount'
73
{noformat}
Example of the waiting thread (one of 73):
{code:java}
"http-nio-8080-exec-756" #365303 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fda1801e000 nid=0x3664 waiting on condition [0x00007fde3abd3000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x000000055dce6220> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$NonfairSync)
..
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.get(LoadingCache.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.getUserCount(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:407)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.isRoleLimitExceeded(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:258)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.ApplicationAuthorizationServiceImpl.getLicensingExactErrors(ApplicationAuthorizationServiceImpl.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.ApplicationAuthorizationServiceImpl.getLicensingAccessErrors(ApplicationAuthorizationServiceImpl.java:78)
...
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.license.SoftwareAuthorizationServiceImpl.getSoftwareLicensingAccessErrors(SoftwareAuthorizationServiceImpl.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.license.SoftwareAuthorizationServiceImpl.verifySoftwareLicense(SoftwareAuthorizationServiceImpl.java:50)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.license.GreenHopperLicenseManagerImpl.verify(GreenHopperLicenseManagerImpl.java:73)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.license.GreenHopperLicenseManagerImpl.isValid(GreenHopperLicenseManagerImpl.java:94)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.license.LicenseServiceImpl.getLicenseInfo(LicenseServiceImpl.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.license.LicenseServiceImpl.isLicensed(LicenseServiceImpl.java:66)
...
{code}
This bug can be amplificated by JRA-64839. JIRA outage will be caused by combination of 2 factors:
 * Too many cache flush events, see JRA-64839
 ** caused by allowing some user Application access
 * Slow cache population, current ticket
 * Those two thread will fight for cache, meantime all threads will wait (this instability could be 5+ min)
 ** one will flush
{code:java}
"http-nio-8080-exec-828" #365452 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fda18083000 nid=0x38e0 waiting on condition [0x00007fde368df000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
...
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.removeAll(LoadingCache.java:320)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.clearUserCounts(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:651)
{code}

 * 
 ** another will populate:
{code:java}
"http-nio-8080-exec-831" #365455 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fda540a8800 nid=0x38e3 runnable [0x00007fde36485000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
..
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.DelegatingUserDao.processUsers(DelegatingUserDao.java:58).
...
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.loadValueAndReleaseLock(LoadingCache.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.get(LoadingCache.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.getUserCount(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:407)
{code}

h3. Workaround

If possible reduce total number of users not used in JIRA (delete user or reduce LDAP sync scope)
 JIRA uses following SQL to load users in {{processUsers}} method:
{code:java}
SELECT U.ID, U.directory_id, U.user_name, U.lower_user_name, U.active, U.created_date, U.updated_date, U.first_name, U.lower_first_name, U.last_name, U.lower_last_name, U.display_name, U.lower_display_name, U.email_address, U.lower_email_address, U.CREDENTIAL, U.deleted_externally, U.EXTERNAL_ID, D.active, D.directory_position FROM cwd_user U INNER JOIN cwd_directory D ON U.directory_id = D.ID WHERE D.active <> 0 ORDER BY U.lower_user_name, D.directory_position;
{code}
h3. Note on Fix

We partially mitigated the problem by implementing JRASERVER-65352, this introduces timeout to the cache population operation and optional async loading. 
 We will monitor the problem and would review it again if it gets more traction.
fields.summary: ActiveUsersCountForLicense cache is populated inefficiently leading to performance degradation across the application

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When submitting an issue through the issue collector it does not provide an option for the issue key. This wouldn't be available via [Advanced use of the JIRA issue Collector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/advanced-use-of-the-jira-issue-collector-802592648.html]. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the ability to provide an external issue key. 
h3. Why this is important
In some shops although the user would not have access to JIRA. When interacting between client and company interactions it would be helpful to have a reference number. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Use [E-mail this issue|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.metainf.jira.plugin.emailissue/cloud/overview] to send a notification to users out the company in the create issue transition of the workflow associated with the issue collector project. 

Use [Service Desk|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk] as it allows interaction between external users with more robust functionality.
fields.summary: Provide issue key when submitting creating an issue via issue collector.

fields.description:
I am developing JIRA plugins using the Maven plugin. JIRA server is up and running all the time (with atlas-debug), while I work on the code and run atlas-package to have QuickReload pick it up and redeploy.

The plugin relies on custom MessageBodyReader and MessageBodyWriter. I have them implemented by the same class, annotated with @Provider.

In the console I can see that the bean is always instantiated. However, it is not always applied to requests. Sometimes something goes wrong in the deployment and the custom reader/writer is not applied. Redeploying without code changes (just running atlas-package) fixes the problem.

I am not sure if it's a problem with the dev environment, but I do not trust it anymore to the point where I would be confident that it would work reliably in production.

FWIW I'm having these issues in JIRA 7.3.1 with AMPS 6.2.11.
fields.summary: MessageBodyReader/MessageBodyWriter don't always work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After an issue is created, clicking on Assign and pasting a screenshot to the comment will fail with the following error:
{code:java}
Unable to render embedded object: File (image-2017-03-10-15-53-03-966.png) not found.{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue.
 # Click on Assign. This will open the Assign screen with a comment Dialog.
 # Copy a screenshot.
 # Paste it in the comment box (Ctrl+v)

h4. Other use case
 * *When edit an issue comment via Agile Board*
 ** Copy and paste screenshot in the comment.
 * *When a user trying to log work*
 ## Click on More
 ## Click on Log work
 ## Paste a screenshot to the Work Description box
 * *Adding an attachment in the 'Add Flag and Comment' screen*
 ## Right-click on a card in JIRA Software board
 ## Click on 'Add Flag and Comment'
 ## Select Visual mode
 ## Paste a screenshot in the Comment field OR add text and change color of text when using the color dropdown in the comment field
 *#* In IE 11 browser, user will got this JS error message:
{code:java}
Exception: Unable to get property 'nodeType' of undefined or null reference
{code}
!JScript-error-message.png|thumbnail!

h4. Another User Case

|Environment|JIRA 7.3.5|

# Access any JIRA issue.
# Take a screen shot.
# *Edit* a comment and add the screenshot to it.
# Update the comment.

*Observation*: If the comment field is in the *visual* mode, you would be able to see the image but when you past, you would get the error. If the comment field is in the *Text* mode, you *cannot* paste the image.

h3. Expected Results

Should work just like pasting a screenshot to a comment on an issue.

!paste-screenshot.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

After pasting the screenshot and clicking on Assign, the following error is displayed.
 !paste-screenshot-Error.png|thumbnail!

After pasting the screenshot, you would get: {{Unable to render embedded object: File (image-2017-08-31-13-16-54-044.png) not found.}}

h3. Workaround
 - Attach the image first to the issue
 - Add the "Attachment" field to the Screen Transition. The attachment will be added when it is pasted.
fields.summary: After an issue is created, clicking on Assign and pasting a screenshot to the comment will fail with 'Unable to render embedded object' error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64358].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA uses XMLRPC to communicate with Confluence in four ways:
 # Retrieve lists of spaces from the instance.
 # Search for content in the instance (globally or by space).
 # Given a {{pageId}}, retrieve page titles and urls for Confluence content.
 # Given a URL, retrieve a {{pageId}} for what is assumed to be Confluence content.

JIRA should use Confluence's REST API to achieve (4).

This aims to resolve a number of issues related to successful retrieval of page info – e.g., when page titles include special characters in them.
fields.summary: Improve the lookup of Confluence content IDs when linking them in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64357].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA uses XMLRPC to communicate with Confluence in four ways:
 # Retrieve lists of spaces from the instance.
 # Search for content in the instance (globally or by space).
 # Given a {{pageId}}, retrieve page titles and urls for Confluence content.
 # Given a URL, retrieve a {{pageId}} for what is assumed to be Confluence content.

JIRA should use Confluence's REST API to achieve (1). This would:
 * Relieve pressure on Confluence, because the XMLRPC API returns *all* spaces in the instance at once.
 * Open up the possibility of implementing an autocomplete component, letting users type to find the specific space they want to search.
 * Open up the possibility of searching within *multiple spaces* instead of just a single one, should this be desirable to do.
fields.summary: Use Confluence's REST API to search for and filter spaces
Login Page tab button should tab to "next" button rather than Privacy Policy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64351].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
Long comments in JIRA can cause performance problems as investigated on [JRA-28519|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28519]
There is a jira.text.field.character.limit set to 32767 by default in JIRA Cloud.
This prevents the saving of a comment with a message: 
{quote}
The entered text is too long. It exceeds the allowed limit of 32767 characters.
{quote}

At that point the user needs to either remove characters or copy the text already formatted on the comment to a text file, save it locally and attach it to the issue.

h3. Suggestion
Provide a full user friendly alternative when saving comments that go over the limit to improve the speed and convenience.

h3. An idea:
JIRA prompts to save the long text in an attachment.
Example:
{quote}
The entered text is too long. Would you like us to create a file attachment with text inside the text blocks?
{quote}
JIRA then parse the \{code\} and \{noformat\} text into a .txt file and attaches it to the issue.
Then it adds the comment with the text that was outside the blocks, adds a preview of the blocks text and a link to the attachment containing the full text. If multiple blocks are find, then it does a different file for each one.

h3. More info
This has been previously asked/requested on:
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/16392971/what-is-the-best-way-to-hide-large-text-in-jira-issue-description
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-59124
fields.summary: Provide a full solution for long comments breaching the character limit

fields.description:
h4. Problem

When an issue has a comment from an anonymous user, it will break the JSON export. This results in an empty export
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 * Enable JSON export: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+To+Enable+JSON+Export+in+JIRA
 * Grant "Browse Projects" and "Add Comments" permissions to "Group: Anyone"
 * Log out and add a comment to an issue; it's going to appear to be submitted an anonymous user
 * Perform JSON export of the issue as admin

This SQL should print comments posted anonymously:
{code}
select * from jiraaction where author is null;
{code}

h4. Expected Results

The JSON exports would complete
h4. Actual Results
 * JSON export fails with 500 error in logs:
{code:java}
2017-03-07 07:41:02,335 http-nio-8080-exec-22 ERROR      [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/].[searchrequest-view]] Servlet.service() for servlet [searchrequest-view] in context with path [] threw exception
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:210)
	at com.google.common.collect.SingletonImmutableSet.<init>(SingletonImmutableSet.java:47)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSet.of(ImmutableSet.java:94)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSet.copyOf(ImmutableSet.java:319)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSet.copyOf(ImmutableSet.java:300)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.exports.transform.DefaultIssueTransformer.getRequiredUsers(DefaultIssueTransformer.java:189)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.exports.IssuesExporterImpl$IssueRequiredUsers.apply(IssuesExporterImpl.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.exports.IssuesExporterImpl$IssueRequiredUsers.apply(IssuesExporterImpl.java:129)
{code}

h4. Workaround
 * Update the database and set an author for the comments
 ** Note that the account does not need to be a real user, it simply needs an entry
fields.summary: JSON Export Fails if an Issue contains a comment from Anonymous User

com.google.template.soy.tofu.SoyTofuException: In 'print' tag, expression "$sidebarContent" evaluates to undefined.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64347].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
For each user login event JIRA flushes number of cached: *activeUsersCount*, *activeUsersCountForLicense*, *licenseRoleGroups*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable cache-flush event logging

fields.description:
h4. Problem
When an issue has an cascading select field with any value, it will break the JSON export.
* If there is no field value, the JSON export will work fine.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable JSON export as detailed here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+To+Enable+JSON+Export+in+JIRA
** Note that this functionality is still in beta
# Create a cascading select field
# Configure the options to add a value (like "abc")
# Create a ticket and populate the cascade field with the "abc" value
# Attempt to do a JSON export on the issue
# Note that it fails with a 500 error
# Perform a JQL search, ensure to include the ticket with a cascading select field
# Attempt to export the search to JSON
# Note that the export stops with truncated result set.

h4. Expected Results
The JSON exports would complete

h4. Actual Results
* JQL JSON export data is truncated and stops upon running into the 500 error
* Issue JSON export fails with 500 error
* Error in logs:
{code}
2017-03-07 22:26:16,052 http-nio-8080-exec-3 ERROR      [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/].[searchrequest-view]] Servlet.service() for servlet [searchrequest-view] in context with path [] threw exception
java.lang.RuntimeException: org.codehaus.jackson.JsonGenerationException: Null key for a Map not allowed in JSON (use a converting NullKeySerializer?)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.views.SearchRequestJsonView.writeSearchResults(SearchRequestJsonView.java:67)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.searchrequestview.DefaultSearchRequestURLHandler.handleRequest(DefaultSearchRequestURLHandler.java:372)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.servlet.SearchRequestViewServlet.doGet(SearchRequestViewServlet.java:25)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:622)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:729)
        ...
Caused by: org.codehaus.jackson.JsonGenerationException: Null key for a Map not allowed in JSON (use a converting NullKeySerializer?)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ser.impl.FailingSerializer.serialize(FailingSerializer.java:34)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ser.std.MapSerializer.serializeFields(MapSerializer.java:237)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ser.std.MapSerializer.serialize(MapSerializer.java:186)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ser.std.MapSerializer.serialize(MapSerializer.java:23)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ser.BeanPropertyWriter.serializeAsField(BeanPropertyWriter.java:446)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ser.std.BeanSerializerBase.serializeFieldsFiltered(BeanSerializerBase.java:203)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ser.BeanSerializer.serialize(BeanSerializer.java:110)
		...
{code}

h4. Workaround
* Remove the cascading select field values from the tickets.
fields.summary: JSON Export Breaks when Issue has Cascading Select Values
Who is currently logged into Jira?

fields.description:
h4. Problem
When CSV import contains a lot of custom fields, like 1000, it causes the field mapping page to time out. Web browsers get stuck trying to render the field mapping page, resulting in script timeouts and import will not be possible.
* tested on Chrome and Firefox

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 1000+ custom fields
** A quick way to do this is via the Data Generator add-on: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-data-generator/server/overview
# Ensure all fields contain Global context (CSV import limitations require global context
# Perform a JQL search and export issues to CSV with *All Fields*
# Once exported, use this file to performa CSV Import
# During the field mapping page, note that the browser eventually times out and never fully loads the page
# Stopping the script will cause page errors and prevent the import from moving forward

h4. Expected Results
* Field mapping page loads, allowing the import to proceed

h4. Actual Results
* Field mapping page never completes, resulting in browser timeouts
* This leads to the inability to move forward with the import
fields.summary: CSV Import Field Mapping Page Causes Browser to Timeout and Fails to Import
Unable to Search User from Number 1000 and above using REST API

And the other way around, understand which fields are used for specific project. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Something like this:
|| CF Name  | Projects           || 
|CF_1        | PROJ1, PROJ3 |
|CF_2        | PROJ2               |
|CF_3        | PROJ3, PROJ4 |
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to have a report for usage of Custom Fields

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a user that is not counted towards the license.
# Create a project and an issue collector with it.
# Set the "Reporter" to Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address"
# Save the configuration and use the HTML template in JIRA Announcement Banner.
# Confirm that the Ribbon is appearing.
# After it, navigate to "Project Permission" and edit it.
# Set the "Create Issue" permission to "Group: Anyone" and save the change.
# Open a new Browser to use a new session and access JIRA.
# In the login Page, click on the Ribbon in an attempt to provide a feedback.
# Set the necessary fields and make sure the email set is the email of the previously created user.
# Click Submit.

h3. Expected Result:
* The issue is created and the reporter set to the registered user:

h3. Actual Result:
* The creation fails with an error in the UI and the logs mentions:
{code}
2017-03-08 18:41:25,516 http-nio-8731-exec-11 ERROR aaaaa@gmail.com 1121x9296x1 15jw1o8 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/collectors/1.0/template/feedback/ee890d62 [c.a.j.c.plugin.rest.TemplateResource] Detected errors in collector 'Test Unlicensed' (id: ee890d62, project PM): [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a JIRA application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.]
{code}

h3. Notes:
* The same Steps has been done with JIRA 6.3.4 and the issue will be created with the reporter set to the unlicensed registered user.
* In a case where the creation is not possible from the "Create" button due to "Reporter" field is "Required" if we allow "Anyone" to modify the reporter, the issue is still be created as long the ticket raiser knows their username and put it in the reporter field.
* Also, while the registered email address is not allowed to create a ticket, the default reporter is not being used.
fields.summary: Issue Collector wouldn't create an issue if the "Email" is set to a unlicensed User

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User is unable to create linked issues in a project he/she is not an agent of. However, he can still link the issue manually from the project he/she is an agent of
 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 Service Desk projects, project A (SDA) and project B (SDB)
# Create a user with JIRA Service Desk application access, and give this user the _Service Desk Team_ role for project A (let's call him Dave)
# Modify the permission schemes for both project such that {{Application access: Any logged in user}} has _Create Issue_ and _Link Issues_ permission
# Create an issue in project A (SDA-2)
# Log in as Dave and access SDA-2
# Click on {{More > Create linked issue}}, create an issue in project B, with the linked issue being SDA-2

h3. Expected Results
# Issue is created in SDB (SDB-2) which is automatically linked to SDA-2

h3. Actual Results
The below error is thrown in the UI
!linkedissue1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
If Dave is not meant to be able to create linked, the behaviour is inconsistent because
# Dave can still create issues in SDB manually (ie. SDB-2)
#* Issue is still created although Dave is unable to access/view it after creation
# Dave can then access SDA-2, click on {{More > Link}}, and link this to SDB-2
#* Although once the link is created, Dave is still unable to see this link in SDA-2 unless _Browse Projects_ permission for project B allows Dave to see SDB issues

h3.Workaround
# Grant Dave the _Service Desk Team_ role for project B; OR
# Follow steps in Notes
fields.summary: Permission to link issues inconsistent in Service Desk projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64338].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Attachment not shown in JIRA Server after migrating to JIRA Server.

* Problem happens because Cloud instance shows *filesize-0* from the issue page. 
* Attachment affected by this problem will also shows *filesize=0* in Cloud instance's fileattachment table.
* Since the value of the filesize is saved as *0* in database, the filesize will be saved as 0 in entites.xml generated for JIRA Server migration.


h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud and JIRA Server 7.3.2


h3. Expected Results

JIRA Cloud saves the exact size of the attachment (in bytes) in fileattachment's filesize column. This will ensure that the backup generated for JIRA Server containes the right values for all the attachments.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA Cloud saves some attachment with 0 bytes fileattachment's filesize column. 


h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: Attachment problem after migrating from JIRA Cloud to Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64336].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When clicking the link Run search without smart query, the results of the query changes, but the JQL in the Advanced/basic search box doesn't change. 
h3. Environment
- Works correctly in 6.4.12
- Does not work correctly in 7.3.1 and 7.2.7 and later
- Affects both Cloud and Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter "my foo*"(without quotes) in the Search box at the top of the page, and switch to Advanced search where you can see the JQL. See img1
 # Click the pop-up link to Run search without smart query.  Notice that the results change, but the JQL stays the same. See img2

h3. Expected Results

After clicking the Run search without smart query link, the JQL query in the search box stays as assignee=currentUser() AND text ~ "foo*"

But the URL in the browser will update to display the appropriate search i.e.:
{code}
https://<BASE_URL>/jira/browse/ABC-123/?jql=text~"my%20foo"
{code}
 
h3.  Workaround
Refresh the page and the actual JQL search being used will be displayed in the search box
fields.summary: Run search without smart query doesn't change JQL query in Advanced/basic search box

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64331].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently JIRA is not explicitly selecting a GC method to use. Most JIRA Server instances are using the oldparallel method or Concurrent (CMS) methods to handle the JAVA garbage collection.
h3. Suggested Solution

By default, JIRA should come with the {{-XX:+UseG1GC}} JVM startup parameter.
h3. Why this is important
 * Improved performance on environments with large heaps
 * consistent GC method across initial deployments
 * The [Tuning garbage collection guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/tuning-garbage-collection-gc-945105109.html] explicitly recommends using G1GC, but neglects to inform users on how to enable it

h3. Workaround

JIRA Admins are able to manually enable the G1GC method by following the steps in [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html] and adding the parameter of {{-XX:+UseG1GC -XX:+ExplicitGCInvokesConcurrent}} to the *JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS=* section.
* See also [Health Check: Explicit Garbage Collection|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/health-check-explicit-garbage-collection-976778100.html].
fields.summary: Ship Jira with G1GC enabled by default

  {panel}

h3. Summary
In some cases JIRA *CaesiumScheduler* can create more then single record in {{clusteredjob}} table. 
This will lead to problems similar to one in JRASERVER-64325: method {{getJobDetails}} expects single uniq value from DB, while {{clusteredjob}} table does not ensure this.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# TBD

h3. Expected Results
Caesium ensures data integrity 

h3. Actual Results
*CaesiumScheduler* can create more then single record in {{clusteredjob}} table.

h3. Notes
Problem is largely mitigated by implementing UNIQ index "clusteredjob_jobid_idx" (job_id) as part of JRASERVER-64325 

h3.Workaround
* Delete duplicated records, see https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-fails-to-start-due-to-too-many-rows-found-for-query-on-clusteredjob-800702971.html
fields.summary: JIRA CaesiumSchedulerService can insert duplicated records into clusteredjob

h3. Summary
When pasting a screenshot to a comment in another browser such as Chrome, then viewing the same issue in Internet Explorer 11. The screenshot is broken. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Copy a *screenshot* in chrome. 
# Paste it into a comment. 
# Open the issue in IE.

h3. Expected Result
 !Chrome-display.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The thread limit health check fails when the thread limit is configured to 4096 as documented in KB article:
 * [Health Check: Thread Limit|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/health-check-thread-limit-858578685.html]

h3. Environment
 * CentOS 7
 * JIRA 7.3.0
 * nproc soft limit set to
 ** 4096 (default)
 ** 4096 via /etc/security/limits.conf configured to:
{noformat}
jira             soft    nofile          4096
jira             hard    nofile          8192
jira             soft    nproc           4096
jira             hard    nproc           8192
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure limits as described in the KB article
 # Restart JIRA

h3. Expected Results

Health check passes without issue.
h3. Actual Results

Thread limit health check fails with warning:
{quote}The maximum number of processes for the user account running JIRA is currently 4096, which can cause performance issues. We recommend increasing this to at least 4,096.
{quote}
!Screen Shot 2017-03-06 at 3.27.34 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Setting the soft limit to a value greater than 4096 (i.e. 4097) will cause the check to pass.
fields.summary: Thread limit health check fails when configured as documented to 4096 threads
Thread Limit health check incorrectly fails if the maximum running user processes is equal to 4096

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64315].
  {panel}

We've got three worklog related clauses available for the JQL: 
* worklogDate
* worklogAuthor
* worklogratio

If we use the clause "worklogdate" or "worklogauthor"  instead of "worklogDate" or "worklogAuthor" , JIRA consider that is not using the default worklog clause and skip the query optimisation feature when constructing the lucene search query. The consequence makes that JIRA took a longer time to return the search result.
fields.summary: Worklog clause should not be case sensitive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64314].
  {panel}

When a project is created in JIRA and a linked Confluence Space is generated, a space shortcut to the JIRA Project automatically appears in the Confluence Space:
* !space_shortcut.png|thumbnail! 

However, there's no Project Shortcut to the Confluence Space created in the JIRA Project. To put it simply, as a user, we want Linked Spaces to show up (automatically) when I display
the Jira Project (sidebar).

For now, It seems like the only way to do this is adding linked space manually.
fields.summary: Automatically Create Project Shortcut to Linked Confluence Space
